item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S459-460; text as passed Senate: CR S459-460; text of measure as introduced: CR S453-454)

Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S459-460; text as passed Senate: CR S459-460; text of measure as introduced: CR S453-454)

item.name: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text:
Declares that the Senate: (1) supports the goals and ideas of "Go Direct"; (2) proclaims February 2006 as "Go Direct Month"; and (3) commends federal, state, and local governments, and the private sector, for promoting February as "Go Direct Month."

Encourages all citizens of the United States to: (1) participate in events and awareness initiatives held during the month of February; (2) become informed about the convenience and safety of direct deposit; and (3) consider signing up for direct deposit of Social Security or other federal benefits.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

bill.title: A resolution designating February 2006 as "Go Direct Month".

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
